wikipedia_page.main: Surgeon-Captain John Ernest Trask (27 October 1861 – 25 July 1896) was an English Army doctor and amateur cricketer during the late 19th century. He served in the Army Medical Services from 1887 until his death from cholera in Sudan during 1896. As a cricketer, he made 16 first-class appearances. A batsman, he played nine times for Somerset between 1884 and 1895, and also played during his time in India.
